intro: Gnaphalium sordescens, commonly known as the smoky everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are typically arranged in compact, spherical clusters, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium sordescens is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
